meanings.definition: A trifle or thing of little importance
meanings.sent1: She considered the gift a bagatelle, easily forgotten.
meanings.sent2: The broken pencil was just a bagatelle in the grand scheme of things.
meanings.sent3: His complaint about the weather seemed like a bagatelle compared to her major concerns.
meanings.sent4: In the vast universe, our problems are mere bagatelles floating in space.
meanings.sent5: The lost button was a bagatelle compared to the torn seam on her dress.

meanings.definition: A short and light musical composition
meanings.sent1: The pianist played a delightful bagatelle during the concert.
meanings.sent2: Mozart composed many bagatelles that are still enjoyed today.
meanings.sent3: The bagatelle filled the room with a cheerful melody.
meanings.sent4: Her humming sounded like a bagatelle drifting through the air.
meanings.sent5: The bagatelle was so catchy, it stayed in my head all day.
